intro: Misopates microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited misopate, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are enclosed in a unique, multi-lobed fruiting structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in limestone-rich soils. Due to habitat loss and climate change, its population has significantly declined, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
